task.name: r.horizon
task.label: Horizon angle computation from a digital elevation model.
task.description: Computes horizon angle height from a digital elevation model. The module has two different modes of operation: 1. Computes the entire horizon around a single point whose coordinates are given with the 'coord' option. The horizon height (in radians). 2. Computes one or more raster maps of the horizon height in a single direction. The input for this is the angle (in degrees), which is measured counterclockwise with east=0, north=90 etc. The output is the horizon height in radians.

parameter.name: elevin
parameter.description: Nombre del mapa ráster de elevación de entrada [metros]

parameter.name: direction
parameter.description: Direction in which you want to know the horizon height

parameter.name: horizonstep
parameter.description: Angle step size for multidirectional horizon [degrees]

parameter.name: bufferzone
parameter.description: For horizon rasters, read from the DEM an extra buffer around the present region

parameter.name: e_buff
parameter.description: For horizon rasters, read from the DEM an extra buffer eastward the present region

parameter.name: w_buff
parameter.description: For horizon rasters, read from the DEM an extra buffer westward the present region

parameter.name: n_buff
parameter.description: For horizon rasters, read from the DEM an extra buffer northward the present region

parameter.name: s_buff
parameter.description: For horizon rasters, read from the DEM an extra buffer southward the present region

parameter.name: maxdistance
parameter.description: The maximum distance to consider when finding the horizon height

parameter.name: horizon
parameter.description: Prefix of the horizon raster output maps

parameter.name: coord
parameter.description: Coordinate for which you want to calculate the horizon

flag.name: d
flag.description: Write output in degrees (default is radians)
